| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [SpliceHack 1.2.0 - monst.c, line 2328](https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.2.0/src/monst.c#L2328) |

A **green moldier**, F, formerly known as a **green mold warrior**, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SpliceHack-Rewrite](/wiki/SpliceHack-Rewrite "SpliceHack-Rewrite") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). The green moldier is a type of [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") [mold](/wiki/Mold "Mold") with an affinity to [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") similar to the [green mold](/wiki/Green_mold "Green mold"), and like all [moldiers](/wiki/Moldier "Moldier") it is capable of [following](/wiki/Follow "Follow") the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") to other levels while it is adjacent.

A green moldier has a weapon attack, as well as a [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") that can trigger when it is attacked in melee, even if the attack kills the green moldier: the passive deals acid damage to attackers without [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") dependent on their level, and has a separate chance of [corroding](/wiki/Corroding "Corroding") certain weapons and armor that hit them. Green moldiers possess acid resistance and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"), and also possess [sickness resistance](/wiki/Sickness_resistance "Sickness resistance") like all fungi and molds; in SpliceHack only, they additionally possess [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), while in Hack'EM only they possess [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

Eating a green moldier [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") cures [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") on the first bite.

## Generation

Randomly generated green moldiers are always created hostile. A green mold can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a green moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

A green moldier can generate from a corpse that reaches 51 turns of age, is not [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic"), and is not located within or on top of a square of [water](/wiki/Water "Water"), [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava"). Corpses infected by green moldiers may be turned into green moldiers themselves.

## Strategy

Green moldiers should be fought using [ranged attacks](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") in order to avoid constant acid damage, especially if there are other hostile monsters accompanying them. Though the extra damage from [copper](/wiki/Copper "Copper") weapons provide an important edge against moldiers in general, the acid from green moldiers can also cause them to corrode - [projectiles](/wiki/Projectiles "Projectiles") used against them should ideally be non-metallic and/or disposable.

When dealing with a room of hostile monsters, dispose of as many of the corpses as reasonably possible (e.g. [eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") them, feeding them to [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet"), etc.) so that you have fewer potential moldiers to deal with - if possible, stash any leftover weapons and other loot so that moldiers cannot use them.

## Encyclopedia entry

Mold, multicellular organism of the division Fungi, typified  
by plant bodies composed of a network of cottony filaments.  
The colors of molds are due to spores borne on the filaments.  
Most molds are saprophytes. Some species (e.g., penicillium)  
are used in making cheese and antibiotics.

\[ The Concise Columbia Encyclopedia ]

Size Medium
Resistances sleep (SpliceHack only), acid, stoning, poison (Hack'EM only)
Resistances conveyed cures stoning

A green moldier:

  • does not breathe.
  • has no eyes.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
Reference SpliceHack 1.2.0 - monst.c, line 2328

A green moldier, F, formerly known as a green mold warrior, is a type of monster that appears in SpliceHack-Rewrite and Hack'EM. The green moldier is a type of humanoid mold with an affinity to acid similar to the green mold, and like all moldiers it is capable of following the hero to other levels while it is adjacent.

A green moldier has a weapon attack, as well as a passive attack that can trigger when it is attacked in melee, even if the attack kills the green moldier: the passive deals acid damage to attackers without acid resistance dependent on their level, and has a separate chance of corroding certain weapons and armor that hit them. Green moldiers possess acid resistance and stoning resistance, and also possess sickness resistance like all fungi and molds; in SpliceHack only, they additionally possess sleep resistance, while in Hack'EM only they possess poison resistance.

Eating a green moldier corpse or tin cures stoning on the first bite.

Generation

Randomly generated green moldiers are always created hostile. A green mold can grow up into a green moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

A green moldier can generate from a corpse that reaches 51 turns of age, is not acidic, and is not located within or on top of a square of water, ice or lava. Corpses infected by green moldiers may be turned into green moldiers themselves.

Strategy

Green moldiers should be fought using ranged attacks in order to avoid constant acid damage, especially if there are other hostile monsters accompanying them. Though the extra damage from copper weapons provide an important edge against moldiers in general, the acid from green moldiers can also cause them to corrode - projectiles used against them should ideally be non-metallic and/or disposable.

When dealing with a room of hostile monsters, dispose of as many of the corpses as reasonably possible (e.g. eating them, feeding them to pets, etc.) so that you have fewer potential moldiers to deal with - if possible, stash any leftover weapons and other loot so that moldiers cannot use them.

Encyclopedia entry

Mold, multicellular organism of the division Fungi, typified
by plant bodies composed of a network of cottony filaments.
The colors of molds are due to spores borne on the filaments.
Most molds are saprophytes. Some species (e.g., penicillium)
are used in making cheese and antibiotics.

[ The Concise Columbia Encyclopedia ]

A '''green moldier''', {{green|F}}, formerly known as a '''green mold warrior''', is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SpliceHack-Rewrite]] and [[Hack'EM]]. The green moldier is a type of [[humanoid]] [[mold]] with an affinity to [[acid]] similar to the [[green mold]], and like all [[moldier]]s it is capable of [[follow]]ing the [[hero]] to other levels while it is adjacent.

A green moldier has a weapon attack, as well as a [[passive attack]] that can trigger when it is attacked in melee, even if the attack kills the green moldier: the passive deals acid damage to attackers without [[acid resistance]] dependent on their level, and has a separate chance of [[corroding]] certain weapons and armor that hit them. Green moldiers possess acid resistance and [[stoning resistance]], and also possess [[sickness resistance]] like all fungi and molds; in SpliceHack only, they additionally possess [[sleep resistance]], while in Hack'EM only they possess [[poison resistance]].

Eating a green moldier [[corpse]] or [[tin]] cures [[stoning]] on the first bite.

==Generation==
Randomly generated green moldiers are always created hostile. A green mold can [[grow up]] into a green moldier, though this does not normally occur in gameplay.

A green moldier can generate from a corpse that reaches 51 turns of age, is not [[acidic]], and is not located within or on top of a square of [[water]], [[ice]] or [[lava]].<!--verify for both variants--> Corpses infected by green moldiers may be turned into green moldiers themselves.

==Strategy==
Green moldiers should be fought using [[ranged attack]]s in order to avoid constant acid damage, especially if there are other hostile monsters accompanying them. Though the extra damage from [[copper]] weapons provide an important edge against moldiers in general, the acid from green moldiers can also cause them to corrode - [[projectiles]] used against them should ideally be non-metallic and/or disposable.

When dealing with a room of hostile monsters, dispose of as many of the corpses as reasonably possible (e.g. [[eating]] them, feeding them to [[pet]]s, etc.) so that you have fewer potential moldiers to deal with - if possible, stash any leftover weapons and other loot so that moldiers cannot use them.
